intro: Taraxacum stanjukoviczii, commonly known as the Stanjukovic’s dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to parts of the Balkans, particularly Serbia and Bosnia and Herzegovina. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and a hollow, leafy stem that supports a single, yellow flower head. It produces a distinctive seed head composed of numerous parachute-like seeds, which are dispersed by the wind. This species is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, showcasing its adaptability to various environmental conditions.
